Hyderabad Internet Outage Sparks Anger: IT Work, Banking and Digital Payments Disrupted
A massive internet outage in Hyderabad disrupted IT work, banking, and digital payments after TGSPDCL cut optical cables. Citizens vent frustration as restoration remains uncertain.
Internet outage in Hyderabad leaves IT professionals and banking services disrupted as citizens vent anger online.
A massive internet outage in Hyderabad on Wednesday left thousands of professionals, banks, and households stranded, triggering widespread anger across the city. The disruption hit hard on a working day, forcing IT employees, businesses, and digital banking services to a standstill.
ðŸš¨ What Happened?
Internet service providers (ISPs) reported that the outage was not due to technical failures within their networks but resulted from indiscriminate cutting of optical fiber cables by the Telangana Southern Power Distribution Company Limited (TGSPDCL).
The Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) confirmed the issue, warning that such actions cause â€œsevere disruptionsâ€ to essential services like internet connectivity.

IT sector hit: Employees already working from home due to heavy rains were left without connectivity.
Banking crisis: Online transactions were stalled, leaving both individuals and institutions unable to process payments.
Digital services stuck: UPI payments, online classes, and other essential services were disrupted.
Frustrated citizens vented their anger on social media, criticizing authorities for cutting cables without prior notice.

â€œThe industry is actively working to restore services as quickly as possible. We urge the department to stop cutting optical cables, as these disruptions severely affect internet connectivity, an essential service today.â€
